alert.note: Alert for Dunklin; Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pemiscot and northeastern Dunklin Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clarkton, or 8 miles southeast of Campbell, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kennett, Malden, Portageville, Campbell, Clarkton, Holcomb, Wardell, St. Francis, Lorine, North Wardell, White Oak, Ipley, Providence, Morris State Park, Baird, Frisbee, McGuires, Townley and Peach Orchard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and southeastern Missouri.
